intro: Humboltia stenopetala, commonly known as the narrow-petaled humboldtia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows as a shrub or small tree, often with woody stems and thick, leathery leaves. Humboltia stenopetala is adapted to coastal environments, tolerating salt spray and sandy soils.
